references.paper_title: Learning quickly when irrelevant attributes abound: A new linear-threshold algorithm
references.reason: This paper introduces the Littlestone dimension, a key concept in online learning theory that is central to the paper's analysis of learnability.

references.paper_title: Multiclass learnability and the ERM principle
references.reason: This paper extends Littlestone's work on online learning to the multi-class setting, which is relevant to the paper's consideration of multi-class concept classes.
This paper investigates online learning in the context of continuous data streams, a topic closely related to the paper's focus on learning from snapshots of data streams.

references.paper_title: The dimension of self-directed online learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of self-directed online learning and develops a dimension that characterizes learnability under this setting, which the current paper extends to scenarios involving continuous data streams.

references.paper_title: Finite-time analysis of the multiarmed bandit problem
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational analysis of online learning with limited feedback, a scenario relevant to the paper's exploration of blind-prediction and update-and-deploy settings.
